articles.title: SA capital spending plunged 37% as state scaled back expenditure - News24
articles.description: Planned spending on capital projects in South Africa plunged 37% last year as the state scaled back expenditure, and the downswing is likely to continue in 2023, economists at the Nedbank Group said.

articles.content:

articles.title: U.N. concerned over Cameroon press safety after second journalist killed - Reuters
articles.description: The United Nations on Tuesday said it was concerned about the safety of journalists in Cameroon after a radio presenter was killed last week, days after the murder of another journalist that shook the central African nation.

articles.author: Prinesha Naidoo
articles.title: Sars boss urges activism by South Africans sick of poor services - TimesLIVE
articles.description: “Let’s get off our seats and let’s be activists to work toward building this society. If this government doesn’t deliver, they shouldn’t be in power.”

articles.author: life
articles.title: Crisis-hit South Africa boosted by 'inspiring' Grammy win - News24
articles.description: South Africa's latest Grammy win provided a ray of light for the crisis-plagued country Monday, with the president hailing the victorious musical trio for putting the nation back "on the world stage".
articles.content:
• Zakes Bantwini, Wouter Kellerman and Nomcebo Zikode brought home South Africa's 10th Grammy Award Sunday at the 2023 ceremony.
